Name: Seal incised in Mesopotamian style
Description: Circular black stone seal-stone, incised with a motif carved in the manner of Late to Roman Period gems in the Near East, with a scene of two human figures in a chariot, the front one holding reins and whip, with sun and moon above, an indistinct oval shape behind, and a figure cut in large part as a zigzag line below. The bearded figures recall Mesopotamian examples.
